title: Competition
description: European decentralization fostered the growth of political and economic competition, birthing the nation-state and the rise of capitalism.

title: Science
description: While eastern Muslim powers slowed scientific progress in their own region, the Christian West advanced militarily and academically.

title: Property
description: Widespread land ownership and its ties to the democratic process gave the United States a more productive, stable footing than its neighbors to the south.

title: Medicine
description: Developed and shared throughout colonial outposts in Africa and elsewhere, Western medicine has the power to double life expectancy.

title: Consumerism
description: The 20th century witnessed a new model of civilization centered around consumption, as American goods and fashion carried the message of Western freedom.

title: Work
description: Protestantism in America stressed hard work, saving, and literacy. Yet today while Americans save less and fewer Europeans attend church, there are around 40 million or more Protestants in China.
